name: playability
content:
playability noun [U]
(VIDEO GAME)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a video game, the quality of being easy and enjoyable to play, or the degree to which a video game is like this: Although the 3D design looks pretty, it doesn't add much to the playability of the game. What i-ninja lacks in gaming innovations it makes up for in sheer playability.

playability noun [U]
(MUSIC)
(of a piece of music or an instrument) the quality of not being too difficult for someone to play, or the degree to which a piece of music or an instrument is like this : It took the music to the threshold of playability. The fretboard is a vital part of a guitar's tone and playability.

playability noun [U]
(SPORTS SURFACE)
sports
  specialized (of a surface on which sports are played) the quality of being easy to play on, or the degree to which a surface is like this : Playability and ball bounce are two of the advantages of the Omnicourt Pro tennis court. The ideal playing surface is judged by its playability and safety, as well as appearance.

(FILMS)
theatre & film
